author: n0price
content:
Hi All,
Can we preventive slashing due to human error deploying the same key by checking the validators status pending_initialized and pending_queued and comparing to active_ongoing status validators?

author: nflaig
content:
The validator status does not tell you whether or not the key is loaded in another validator client, it just tells the status of the validator onchain, if it's active (such as `active_ongoing`), then it will receive duties and the validator client will produce messages which are slashable if the key is loaded twice.

There is no simple way to detect if a key is loaded in another validator client instance already other than observing messages (like attestations) onchain, this is what doppelganger protection does and is supported by all clients.
